p: The SARS-CoV-2 S protein binds to the host cell receptor and induces virusâ€“cell membrane fusion, which plays a vital role in the process of virus invasion. Moreover, the high affinity between the S protein and ACE2 increases the infectivity of SARS-CoV-2. Mammals including pangolins, pets (dogs and cats), and members of Cricetidae may be important for determining key residues for association with S from SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 [ 80]. Further understanding of the structure and function of SARS-CoV-2 S will allow for additional information regarding invasion and pathogenesis of the virus, which will support the discovery of antiviral therapeutics and precision vaccine design.
